bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, August 27, 1903

div1.p: Carroll thanks Howard for the eggs and mosquitoes. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to L. O. Howard, August 27, 1903
div1.opener:
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MANET
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE
Office of the Chief, Letters Received
Three Centimeters
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
ARMY MEDICAL SCHOOL,
WASHINGTON.
✓
August 27, 1903.
Dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Thank you
very much for the eggs
and mosquitoes. The eggs
are particularly valuable
because I want to send
some away. I shall pick
out the Stegomyiae and em-
bed them for cutting. I received
a second lot of mosquitoes
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MANET
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE
Office of the Chief, Letters Received
Three Centimeters
from New Orleans and have
several batches of eggs (in
the water) and a few
mosquitoes. I trust these
will supply my needs at
present. I shall be very
glad to receive a few
more eggs but I shall not
need any more mosquitoes.

Again thanking you for
your many kindnesses, these
included, believe me,
